11.4.22  1:27 pm   Ive noticed that looking at the different music categories and genres on apple music, there is always one musician plastered on the button for that genre. That got me thinking about how the mug of an artist plastered on something is quite often how music is marketed, and that much of musical imagery is focused around the artist themselves. This is in contrast with using imagery that is not focused on a person, things that are abstract and represent the tone and feeling of whatever music they are paired with. Imagery is a big part of your music, so i was wondering if you had any thoughts on this.

      music is kind of a secret/special sauce. So this begs the question: how do you eat just the sauce? The idea of paying attention to music separately is actually kind of weird...... and truly it's almost impossible to actually pay direct attention to only music. i think you'll find that SOMETHING has to take the focus. and often, by default, it's the identity of the artist the music is associated with

11.3.22  9:49 pm   Where can i get myself some of those air drums that you have?

      i was gonna say spend some time playing real drums. but now that i think about it, maybe you could just spend a lot of time watching real drummers and you might be able to get it pretty good that way. for example, i can air juggle pretty good but i can't juggle

11.3.22  8:36 pm   do the colors on the juggling stick things in "out to lunch" have any meaning or are they just colors

      i almost wanted them to be the same color, but the reason it's important that they are different colors is because this is an animation (not real) so it's technically more powerful to prove that there are actually 3 clubs. Otherwise it might feel like the animation loop is only 1/3 of the length it actually is. it's important to see the individual clubs changing hands. I made the juggling animation first, and i had 3 different colors just so i could tell them apart. Then i modeled the rooms and did the rest of the animation. Then i had to deal with whether the colors looked good with the scene. There are several moments where 1 club is featured (thrown into the ceiling tile, or onto the light, or when the last 2 go up to the atrium.) So i needed to find a color scheme which looked good with all 3 together, and, also looked good when the individual ones are featured. And switching the clubs at that point was out of the question. so i had to juggle the colors around a bit to make all the scenes look good with the same color scheme. That is generally the meaning of colors: how they look, and how the look feels. And with 3 different but consistent interchanging items, that became somewhat of a puzzle for me

11.3.22  8:11 pm   what do you think of religion?

      i've noticed, it's usually only called that when someone else does it

11.3.22  7:17 pm   i always trying to impress different people for no reason. every time i'm doing it, i'm starting to be disappointed and my mood is \ for a couple of days or even weeks. the worst thing is after that i can't interact, or even thinking about this people because of the shame without any reason. what am i doing wrong, should i fix myself? 

      think of some of the ways you like to be impressed. maybe you can dedicate some time to some of those things, and make a career out of it

11.3.22  6:17 pm   Writing this from a school computer. What are your thoughts on school?

      sometimes it's more fun to be the teacher. sometimes it's more fun to be the curriculum designer

11.3.22  5:39 pm   I am very passionate about music, and love to talk about songs, specifically what I like about them, such as the instrumentals, the vocals, the setup of a chorus, the lyrics itself, etc. I'm lucky to have friends who find it entertaining, as I sometimes can go on for a while. the thing is, sometimes I find it hard to communicate some of the things I love about these songs, sometimes because I don't know what certain music terms are,

     trust me, that won't make it easier. love, and songs, are mysterious and no one can truly figure out exactly 'why' they work the way they do

     I can't even read sheet music, and don't play an instrument. but the rest of the time it's because certain sounds just don't have words to describe them, it's very hard to explain the vibes.

     even at the highest levels of literacy, education, and experience, musicians and music producers still have to use references and analogies to describe the vibe they're going for

     do you know how best to still explain it other than just moving your hands around and going "it just sounds so *incomprehensible noises*, ya know?"

     anything goes

11.3.22  5:19 pm   will i be able to make good songs if i can't even play any already existing songs

      maybe

11.3.22  3:54 pm   have you ever asked yourself a question?

      sure, i do it all the time. but not on this page of course. i can communicate with myself more directly if i put my mind to it

11.3.22  3:47 pm   I went to the bank to steal some money, but they said it's not allowed. Any advice?

      how about depicting it in a work of fiction

11.3.22  3:36 pm   wondering how you're recovering from the time you tried to get to the arctic by nightfall

      i don't recall that, but i recall a similar situation where i was trying to write my way to the SOUTH pole by nightfall. and the issue there was just that i was trying to figure out how to end a piece of writing. and that's a skill i now find myself working on again, today

11.3.22  10:54 am   can you have context without content

     sure

     (or, conversely, content without context)?

     sure

     if so, what happens if you do it with music?

     it probably wouldn't work, but, if it does work, then it turns out you probably did have both all along and didn't realize it. those things are sneaky
